Top-3 Similar Questions: au_742973: Start / Stop OpenVPN client on machine with OpenVPN server running (command line)
au_229800: How to auto start openvpn (client) on Ubuntu CLI?
au_639855: How to start the OpenVPN client service on Ubuntu 15.04
Top-3 Scripts:
au_229800: /etc/openvpn

cd /etc/openvpn

sudo nano /etc/default/openvpn

sudo service openvpn start

Explanations about Options.--auth-user-pass:
Authenticate with server using username/password. up is a file containing
 username/password on 2 lines. If the password line is missing, OpenVPN will prompt
 for one.
Explanations about Options.--auth-nocache: Don't cache --askpass or --auth-user-pass username/passwords in virtual memory.
Explanations about Options.--nobind:
Do not bind to local address and port. The IP stack will allocate a dynamic port
 for returning packets. Since the value of the dynamic port could not be known in
 advance by a peer, this option is only suitable for peers which will be initiating
 connections by using the --remote option.
Explanations about Options.--config:
Load additional config options from file where each line corresponds to one command
 line option, but with the leading '--' removed.

Top-3 Similar Questions: so_49764989: Cannot start apache automatically with docker
Top-3 Scripts:
so_49764989: FROM ubuntu:latest
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y apache2 php libapache2-mod-php php-mcrypt php-mysql php-cli php-curl php-xml php-intl php-mbstring git vim composer curl

COPY . /var/www/example
COPY vhost.conf /etc/apache2/sites-available/example.conf

RUN a2ensite example
RUN chown -R www-data:www-data /var/www/example/logs
CMD ["/usr/sbin/apachectl", "-D", "FOREGROUND"]
